# TidyTuesday

Join the R4DS Online Learning Community in the weekly #TidyTuesday event!
Every week we post a raw dataset, a chart or article related to that dataset, and ask you to explore the data.
While the dataset will be “tamed”, it will not always be tidy! As such you might need to apply various R for Data Science techniques to wrangle the data into a true tidy format.
The goal of TidyTuesday is to apply your R skills, get feedback, explore other’s work, and connect with the greater #RStats community!
As such we encourage everyone of all skills to participate!

```{r}
#| label: setup
#| include: false

library(tidyverse)
library(tidytuesdayR)

theme_set(theme_light())
```

# Load the weekly Data

Download the weekly data and make available in the `tt` object.

```{r}
#| label: Load

tt <- tt_load("2025-10-28")

```

Explore the data and process it into a nice format for plotting! Access each dataset by name by using a dollarsign after the `tt` object and then the name of the data set.

```{r}

```


# Visualize

Using your processed dataset, create your unique visualization.

```{r}
#| label: Visualize

draw_gender_person_role <- function(x) {
  prizes |> 
    filter(prize_alias != "Women's Prize for Fiction") |> 
    ggplot(aes({{ x }})) +
    geom_bar(aes(fill = gender)) +
    facet_wrap(vars(person_role)) +
    coord_flip()
}

draw_gender_person_role(prize_genre)
draw_gender_person_role(prize_institution)
draw_gender_person_role(prize_alias)
draw_gender_person_role(cut(prize_year, breaks = 0:7 * 5 + 1990))

prizes |>
  filter(person_role == "winner") |>
  mutate(
    decade = paste0(prize_year %/% 10 * 10, "s"),
    prize_alias = prize_alias |> 
      fct_reorder(gender == "man", .fun = mean)
  ) |> 
  ggplot(aes(prize_alias)) +
  geom_bar(aes(fill = gender)) +
  facet_wrap(vars(decade)) +
  coord_flip()

man_ratios <- prizes |>
  filter(person_role == "winner") |>
  mutate(
    decade = paste0(prize_year %/% 10 * 10, "s"),
    decade = if_else(decade %in% c("2010s", "2020s"),
                     "2010s/2020s", decade)
  ) |> 
  mutate(
    n = n(),
    .by = prize_alias
  ) |> 
  filter(n > 26) |> 
  summarize(
    man_ratio = mean(gender == "man"),
    .by = c(prize_alias, decade)
  ) |> 
  mutate(
    prize_alias = fct_reorder2(prize_alias, decade, man_ratio)
  )

p <- man_ratios |> 
  ggplot(aes(decade, man_ratio)) +
  geom_line(aes(group = prize_alias, color = prize_alias)) +
  geom_line(aes(group = prize_alias, color = prize_alias),
            linewidth = 1.5,
            data = man_ratios |> filter(prize_alias == "Gold Dagger")) +
  geom_point(aes(color = prize_alias)) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format()) +
  labs(x = NULL, y = "Man ratio in winners", color = "Prize",
       title = "While man ratio in winners decreases in most British Literary Prizes,\nit increases in Gold Dagger",
       caption = "Source: Post45 Data Collective") +
  theme(plot.caption.position = "plot")
```
